byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

abstract: Emails sent by top Democratic National Committee officials, posted by WikiLeaks, reveal rampant criticism and mockery of Sen Bernie Sanders's presidential campaign; emails reveal messages that suggest chairwoman Rep Debbie Wasserman Schultz and others heavily favored Hillary Clinton over Sanders.

headline.print_headline: Emails Suggest That Democratic Officials Scoffed at Sanders’s Campaign
headline.main: Released Emails Suggest the D.N.C. Derided the Sanders Campaign

snippet: Some of the nearly 20,000 messages, made public through WikiLeaks, show officials at the Democratic National Committee thought little of Mr. Sanders’ chances of becoming president....
lead_paragraph: Some of the nearly 20,000 messages, made public through WikiLeaks, show officials at the Democratic National Committee thought little of Mr. Sanders’ chances of becoming president.
